chapter.title: Working With Document Types
chapter.para: The following sections describe working with document types. Document types allow you to describe the components of a mail piece. You can define one or more document types for each configured process unit. The following actions are supported in the Document Types view:

sect1.title: Defining a Document Type
sect1.para: You can define a new document type. You can configure the desired properties in a separate dialog.
Proceed as follows to create a new document type.

step.para: Switch to the Document Types view.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Create
(Create).

result.para: The Create Document Type dialog opens.

step.para: In the Create Document Type dialog, enter the desired settings for the new document type.
In the Create Document Type dialog, click OK to create the document type with the specified settings.

result.para: The dialog closes and the new document type is displayed in the list of configured document types.

sect1.title: Listing Document Types
sect1.para: You can display an overview of the configured document types in the workspace of the Document Types view.
The overview table displays the following information for each configured document type by default:

listitem.para: The unique identifier of the document type.
Reference to the medium (for more information, see ). It is used for weight calculation of the document.
Minimum number of documents of this type that is required for a mail piece.
Maximum number of documents of this type that is allowed for a mail piece.

note.para: The value Minimum Number always must be smaller than the value Maximum Number.

listitem.para: Indicates, whether the document type can be shipped by itself. Valid available values are true (default) and false. With the value true, this document can be shipped by itself in a mail piece.

sect1.title: Displaying Document Type Details
sect1.para: You can display the details for a specific document type in the details pane. Compared to the overview table the details pane contains more information.

mediaobject.alt: Document Types view with details pane

sect1.para: The following information is currently available in the details pane:

listitem.para: The unique identifier of the document type.
Only the value directories is currently supported.
Reference to the medium (for more information, see ). It is used for weight calculation of the document.
Minimum number of documents of this type that is required for a mail piece.
Maximum number of documents of this type that is allowed for a mail piece.

note.para: The value Minimum Number always must be smaller than the value Maximum Number.

listitem.para: Indicates, whether the document type can be shipped by itself. Valid available values are true (default) and false. With the value true, this document can be shipped by itself in a mail piece.

sect1.title: Modifying a Document Type
sect1.para: You can edit the document type properties.

note.para: Please keep in mind that you can not use this action to edit the name of the document type. To modify the name of the document type, create a new document type with the desired name (see ).

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the values of an existing document type:

step.para: Switch to the Document Types view.
Double-click the desired row in the overview table.

result.para: The entry switches to editing mode.

step.para:
Enter the desired values and click Save button
, to save the new values.

sect1.title: Modifying Multiple Document Types
sect1.para: You can edit selected values for multiple document types in one step.

note.para: Please keep in mind that with this function, you define the same values for all selected document types.

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the settings of the selected document types.

step.para: Switch to the Document Types view.
Select at least two document types from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the web interface, click Icon Edit
(Edit).
Tick the checkbox in front of each value you want to change for all selected document types.
In the Process field, specify the process to which all selected document types should be linked.
In the Print Mode field, specify whether the document type should be for simplex or duplex printing.
In the Media field, specify to which configured media the document type should be linked.
In the Minimum Number field, specify the minimum number of documents of this type that is required for a mail piece.
In the Maximum Number field, specify the maximum number of documents of this type that can be present in a mail piece.

note.para: The value Minimum Number always must be smaller than the value Maximum Number.

step.para: In the Allow Single field, specify whether this document type can be sent alone. Valid available values are true (default) and false. With the value true, this document can be shipped by itself in a mail piece.
In the Tray field, specify the desired output tray.
In the Channel field, specify the desired output channel.
In the Type field, specify the document type (format).

sect1.title: Deleting Document Types
sect1.para: Use this action to delete a single document types or multiple document types. Proceed as follows to delete one or more document type(s).

step.para: Switch to the Document Types view.
Select at least one document type from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Delete
(Delete).

result.para: The confirmation dialog Delete Document Types opens.

step.para: In the confirmation dialog Delete Document Types, click OK to delete the selected document type (or document types).
In the confirmation dialog Delete Document Types, click Cancel to close the dialog without deleting the selected document type(s).

result.para: If the document types have been successfully deleted, a success message is displayed.
If the document type(s) could not be deleted, a corresponding error message is displayed.
